info.subtitle: HOWTOs about using Chinese in Debian

dedication.para: For all Debian Chinese Users and Developers.

preface.title: Foreword
preface.para: This Debian Chinese FAQ provides with suggestions and instructions about common problems and solutions when using Chinese under Debian.
We welcome suggestions around improving this document. Should you have any idea, please contact us via our maillist: debian-chinese-gb@lists.debian.org and debian-chinese-big5@lists.debian.org.
The document distributed with Debian package might be outdated. You may view the latest version of Debian Chinese FAQ online.

chapter.title: Overview of Chinese support in Debian
chapter.para: Chinese and eastern Asian language support on desktop Linux has improved greatly since the beginning of the twenty-first century.
Debian follows the multilanguage support and specifications as other Linus distributions do. Thing should work out-of-box. under most circumstances.

However, to fully utilize the works of localization in Debian, you are suggested to use tasksel to select proper packages. Localization packages include input methods, translation packs, fonts, dictionaries, etc. Details will be explained below.

chapter.title: Chinese Documents in Debian
chapter.para: Documents are provided by either software upstream or Debian itself. Debian cannot control whether certain software could provide with translated documents or not. However, there are some efforts specific to Debian that try to provide you with translated texts about software usage and things around Debian.
